required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Using Artificial Intelligence by Chest Radiography
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Using Artificial Intelligence by Chest Radiography

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will develop an artificial intelligence model to predict left ventricular ejection fraction using chest radiographic images and transthoracic echocardiography data.

detailed_description.textblock:
Echocardiography should be considered at an early stage in patients who have first developed heart failure or who do not have information about heart function, but the examination may be delayed due to lack of time and manpower in the actual medical field.
Primary Objective: Use chest radiographs to predict the left ventricular ejection fraction

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within two weeks of chest X-ray
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the performance of chest X-ray based artificial intelligence algorithms to identify individuals with reduced ejection fraction (<40%)

intervention.intervention_name: Scanning Chest X-rays and performing AI algorithms on images

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing a transthoracic echocardiogram will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults who are 18 years and older
- Complete a transthoracic echocardiogram within 14 days before or after chest X-ray
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal
- Uncertain radiographs
- Uncertain tests results

overall_official.affiliation: Yongin Severance Hospital, Yonsei University College of Medicine
